reviews.review_msg: I took his POL 340 class back in the fall semester. Not only is he hilarious, but he is also caring about his students. At first he may seem unapproachable, but I promise that he is. I would take his class again and I recommend others to take 340 or his other POL courses! He is a harder grader, but I find that I learn more that way.

Dr. Hoffman is easily one of my favourite professors at SFU. Amazing lectures. Funny. His knowledge for the class and enthusiasm of each topic is what made him a great professor. 141 is not a tough course and I highly recommend taking it even as an elective

Very funny prof, has engaging lectures. Only reason why it's a 4 and not a 5 is because he is sometimes disorganized, but great in every other aspect. For the full 100% in this class you must do the readings which can be  lengthy and attend lectures because he verbally explains the material with more detail compared to his powerpoint slides.

Aaron Hoffman is unfit to be a professor. He is far too opinionated in his own views affecting his own teachings. He is also very unprofessional, unorganized, and quite honestly his style of teaching isn't really appropriate for the topics discussed. 
He will encourage you to raise your hand for questions or answers and cut you off mid sentence.

Aaron is a real gem! I thoroughly enjoyed his course for 1.) entertainment purposes (Hoffman is a comedian) and 2.) for his excellent feedback, unwavering encouragement, and focus on teaching useful and transferrable skills in all aspects of writing. I will forever cherish what Hoffman taught me. One of SFU's best.

Given all the good reviews on here I have to say I was a bit disappointed with Professor Hoffman. He is a funny guy and he respects all his students (you're always welcome to voice your opinion in class) but I found him generally quite disorganized and a really tough marker. This is a writing course so expect a lot of assignments.

He will warn you about the amount of writing in the class, don't be surprised. Funny teacher with interesting lectures and a reasonable marker. There was a group project and lots of breakout rooms, I liked that but YMMV. The writing was hard for me, but others may find it different.

Surprised he went into academics, could have made it doing stand up comedy. Pretty solid prof overall, course material felt a bit thin at times but his feedback helped improve my writing for sure. Lectures felt like an oddly educational sitcom, tons of fun.

Dr. Hoffman is, without a doubt, the best professor that the political science department of SFU has. He will push you to think and write better. He has high expectations for his students but he will help you through the process. He is unreasonably funny and genuinely cares about the success of his students.

Hoffman is an awesome and funny lecturer as well as a really nice person. Although there were quite a few graded assignments that are quite tedious at times and only worth 5% of your grade, the course was rather interesting and engaging. If you put in the work you will definitely do well.
